Title: Blade
Description: A half-vampire, half-mortal man becomes a protector of the mortal race, while slaying evil vampires.

Genre.Name: Action
Genre.Description: Action film is a film genre in which the protagonist or protagonists are thrust into a series of events that typically include violence, extended fighting, physical feats, rescues and frantic chases.

Director.Name: Stephen Norrington
Director.Bio: Stephen Norrington was an American director, producer, and screenwriter.

Title: The Matrix
Description: The Film depicts a dystopian future in which humanity is unknowingly trapped inside a simulated reality, the Matrix, which intelligent machines have created to distract humans while using their bodies as an energy source.

Genre.Name: Science Fiction
Genre.Description: Science fiction (or sci-fi) is a film genre that uses speculative, fictional science-based depictions of phenomena that are not fully accepted by mainstream.

Director.Name: Lana Wachowski
Director.Bio: Lana formerly known as Andy Wachowski is an American film and television directors, writers and producers.

Title: The Shawshank Redemption
Description: The Shawshank Redemption is a 1994 American drama film based on the 1982 Stephen King novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Frank Darabont
Director.Bio: Darabont is an American film director, screenwriter and producer. He has been nominated for three Academy Awards and a Golden Globe Award.

Title: Oldboy
Description: The film follows the story of Oh Dae-su, who is imprisoned in a cell which resembles a hotel room for 15 years without knowing the identity of his captor or his captor's motives.

Genre.Name: Action
Genre.Description: Action film is a film genre in which the protagonist or protagonists are thrust into a series of events that typically include violence, extended fighting, physical feats, rescues and frantic chases.

Director.Name: FPark Chan-wook
Director.Bio: UPDATE FPark Chan-wook is a South Korean film director, screenwriter, producer, and former film critic

Title: The Handmaiden
Description: It is inspired by the 2002 novel Fingersmith by Welsh writer Sarah Waters, with the setting changed from Victorian era Britain to Korea under Japanese colonial rule.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thriller film, also known as suspense film or suspense thriller, is a broad film genre that involves excitement and suspense in the audience.

Director.Name: FPark Chan-wook
Director.Bio: UPDATE FPark Chan-wook is a South Korean film director, screenwriter, producer, and former film critic

Title: The Grandmaster
Description: The Grandmaster is about Wing Chun grandmaster Ip Man reflects on the nature of martial arts as he battles a dozen combatants during a rainstorm in Foshan.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Wong Kar-Wai
Director.Bio: Wong Kar-wai is a Hong Kong film director, screenwriter, and producer.

Title: Goodfellas
Description: Goodfellas is a film adaptation of the 1985 nonfiction book Wiseguy by Pileggi. Starring Robert De Niro, Ray Liotta, Joe Pesci, Lorraine Bracco and Paul Sorvino, the film narrates the rise and fall of mob associate Henry Hill and his friends and family from 1955 to 1980.

Genre.Name: Crime
Genre.Description: Crime films, in the broadest sense, is a film genre inspired by and analogous to the crime fiction literary genre.

Director.Name: Martin Charles Scorsese
Director.Bio: Martin Charles Scorsese is an American film and television director, producer, screenwriter, and film historian, in addition to occasionally serving as an actor.

Title: The Godfather
Description: The Godfather is a 1972 American epic crime film directed by Francis Ford Coppola, who co-wrote the screenplay with Mario Puzo, based on Puzo's best-selling 1969 novel of the same name.

Genre.Name: Crime
Genre.Description: Crime films, in the broadest sense, is a film genre inspired by and analogous to the crime fiction literary genre.

Director.Name: Francis Ford Coppola
Director.Bio: Francis Ford Coppola is an American film director, producer, and screenwriter.

Title: Seven Samurai
Description: The story takes place in 1586[3] during the Sengoku period of Japanese history. It follows the story of a village of desperate farmers who hire seven r≈çnin (masterless samurai) to combat bandits who will return after the harvest to steal their crops.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Akira Kurosawa
Director.Bio: Akira Kurosawa was a Japanese filmmaker and painter who directed 30 films in a career spanning 57 years.

Title: Undercover Brother
Description: UPDATE The film begins with a backstory of how African-American cultures popularity with the American public began to decline in the 1980s, when style and originality began to lose appeal in the public eye due to the persistent efforts of The Man , a powerful Caucasian man in control of a secret organization that seeks to undermine the African-American community as well as the cultures of other minorities.

Genre.Name: Comedy
Genre.Description: Comedy is a genre of film in which the main emphasis is on humor. These films are designed to make the audience laugh through amusement and most often work by exaggerating characteristics for humorous effect.

Director.Name: Malcolm D. Lee
Director.Bio: Malcolm D. Lee is an American director, producer and screenwriter.
